name: Grand Hyatt San Antonio

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay. Easy access to the convention center and the River Walk. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. The restaurant was a little pricey but the food and service was excellent. Denny's was right across the street for a budget friendly breakfast.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: Stay in this hotel for 7 days because there is a conference meeting co-located.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.text: Check-in and check-out are fast and there is nothing special. Though there are some previous reviews commenting that the Staff is great and lovely, I do not experience anything the same (even though I am a Platinum Member) and in short, it is uneventful at all.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is nice though it is at the lower floor. Comfortable bed and nice room setting that makes one feel at home. Internet, however, is poor regardless of whether it is wired or wireless. The connectivity is poor that it makes my PC always disconnected. Another thing that is worth mentioning is that during my first night of my stay, I find a pizza advertisement leaflet flipped through the door ... and this pizza house is indeed not co-located in this hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: Nevertheless, I love the Fitness Center especially those high-quality treadmills and with a great city view. Room service, the buffet lunch served in Achiote River Cafe and the drink served in Bar Rojo are all excellent.
reviews.title: San Antonio Rock n Roll Marathon

reviews.text: This hotel had it all. Great views from the room, attentive staff and a location that could not be beat. The arrival was smooth we parked valet because it was only a little more than regular parking which I dont like about downtown San Antonio but it is that way at every hotel. The front desk staff move fast. The rooms were spacious and clean and updated. The restaurant was outstanding (though pricey). Easy walking to the Alamo dome and right on the riverwalk...I did think charging for the business center was a little odd. Wish I could have used the pool it looked great but it was cold outside. The gym is also great. We will stay again!!!
reviews.title: Great Room Great Service Perfect Location

reviews.text: This hotel is right on the Riverwalk with easy access to all the restaurants and shops. Check in/out can get crowded and the valet area is kind of tight for all the cars going in and out, but it's a great location to get on and off the highway since you don't have to go but one block off of 37. We didn't dine at the restaurant, but there is a convenient coffee shop that even has wine by the bottle. The rooms were well maintained and clean, everything looked brand new. I would recommend to anyone staying on the Riverwalk.
reviews.title: Good Location, Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and i enjoyed a relaxing weekend in San Antonio at the Grand Hyatt. The hotel is beaulitful, the room was nicely appionted, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The front desk staff was knowledgable and even helped plan a running route for me. The Grand Club was nice with a great view of the skyline. Will defiantely stay here next time visit San Antonio.
reviews.title: Great accomodations, service, location

reviews.text: We were here for a company event, including an overnight stay. I must say that although the room was pleasant enough (although nothing special by any stretch) and the event staff excellant, everything else fell far short. The valets were exceptionally unprofessional and saying they were less than helpful is a gross understatement. Check in was quick, efficient and brusque as was check-out. Our very simple request to have a cab called for us, which we do every year for these events and have never had a problem with at any other hotel downtown, was first shuffled of to "the valets will get one for you" and then with the valets it was a vague gesture towards the street "Oh, they're out there all along the strip". After some time attempting to find ANY cab we wound up going back to our room, changing clothes, and walking. We received multiple calls all though the night from the front desk and valet parking because either someone had given them the wrong room number, or there had been a mixup somewhere so our night was far less than restful - one would think that after the first two times being informed that they had the wrong room they might have caught a clue. Overall, I would say that in spite of the excellant location and lovely decor, the very pleasant coffee bar and restaurant/bar downstairs, and the pleasant event staff this hotel has some serious issues to work on when it comes to customer service.
reviews.title: Nice room, but...

reviews.text: We chose this hotel for a 2 night stay after Thanksgiving. When we pulled our car into the porte-cochere (check-in area), the valet seemed a little gruff when he found out we were self-parking. He demanded to hold our keys while we checked in and intentionally stood by our car waiting for a tip when we returned. Check-in was easy and front desk staff was helpful and accommodating. Beautiful hotel with updated, artsy decor; very spacious, almost cavernous. I requested a view of the river, but was advised there is no view of the river at this hotel, thus the view of the city (not downtown) was disappointing, but not a big deal. The room was comfortable, simple. White sheets covered the feather duvet; no nasty bed spreads here! Amenities as expected: coffee pot, hair dryer, iron and board. I believe there was an ipod docking station, altough we didn't use it.
reviews.title: Riverwalk Beauty

reviews.text: This is a large convention hotel located next to the convention center and on a branch of the Riverwalk. It is also an older hotel, which is good and bad. The hotel appears to be in very good repair and the design style of those days allowed for large rooms. Furnishing were very nice; the room was very clean, shower hot, TV was large flat screen. The location is only minutes walk to shopping at the Rivercenter or bars/restaurants along the Riverwalk. As a convention hotel, however, prices, exclusive of the room, were ala carte and expensive: coffee and bagels for 2 was $20; parking $25, etc. Other than these issues, it's fine. Book early for a cheap rate.
reviews.title: yes but

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hyatt on business. I had a room on the 18th floor. The hotel is in a great location. The river walk is just outside the lower lobby area. It’s less than a 10 minute walk to the Alamo. I thought the rooms were a little small but still nice. The staff was great. Check in was fast without any issues. The restaurant is great for breakfast. I would recommend going out on the river walk for lunch. No complaints.
reviews.title: Nice place great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room had a great view of the Alamodome and Tower of the Americas...we stayed one night while in town for a company party. The bar downstairs was awesome! Bartender recommended a drink (sangria) and it was excellent. Parking is steep to park overnight, and wifi was $13/day. Right on the riverwalk which was nice for a late night stroll. The hotel restaurant isn't open late, but numerous restaurants on the riverwalk are. I would def stay again!
reviews.title: Roomy and comfy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely hotel right on the Riverwalk. Spacious room (had a Grand King room) - very well appointed, clean and welcoming. Nightstand clock even had an iPod port. Wonderful view of downtown. Friendly staff.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel - but compare ALL costs

reviews.text: Cons: We got a decent price through Expedia ($119) however... parking is $25/day, Wifi costs 12/day (I think... might be more like $18... don't remember), no free breakfast buffet, etc. So if you make use of all the extras obviously it's going to run higher.
reviews.title: Great facility - small room
A "road warrior" convention center hotel; OK for single biz traveler.
reviews.text: We got a GREAT deal on this hotel (a week free as a time share trade) and that made it worth it, but the room (an upgrade according to the very helpful & knowledgable desk person) was tiny and remarkably poorly designed. Imagine a closet door that opens across the entire entry, blocking a second person in the room from getting to the bathrooom while hubby is rummaging for a shirt.

On the plus side, a quiet River Walk location just a short stroll to the tourist action. The front desk staff is superb. Valet parkers too. The downstairs casual cafe has a nice outside bar and great Margaritas (fresh lime juice.) Breakfast there was tasty too.
reviews.title: Riverwal at its best

reviews.text: Slightly off the main strip of Riverwalk restaurants and noise. Quiet, comfortable, clean, very easy access to the restaurants and Alamadome. Obtained super rates on 800 hotels- less than half the listed price. Even at full rate, probably not a bad deal. Brunch was the usual hotel pricey, but had extensive selection. If you want cheap, Denny's is right across the street. Valet parking cost $30 plus tax per day- bit surprised since it was Texas and not NYC, but it was very convenient. Only minor irritation: they charge $6 for internet access. Marriott across the street "includes" the access in hotel price. So, used my smart phone instead.
reviews.title: Loved the Grand Hyatt and would stay again!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Came here for a conference within the hotel. Great experience.
reviews.title: Grand Hyatt San Antonio for the Woman's NCAA Tourament April 1st-7th 2010

reviews.text: Everyone who works here was very professional and courteous. The hotel is a 10-15 min ride in a cab for about 25 bucks. You can also get a shuttle I am told. I arrived at the hotel after midnight, was super tired and hungry. Had a quick polite check-in and was directed to the 24 hour coffee shop/convenience store. It was great. I got soup. Though I burned my mouth and hand, it was eventually good:)
reviews.title: Heres what you need to know

reviews.text: After reading the reviews of others, I though oh no 4 nights in this hotel is not going to be fun. I got a room on a high floor and in the back, so it was quiet. The room was large, relatively clean, bed and pillows OK, linens OK. The house keeping was good and the service overall was good. I did bring my own toiletries, so I did not have to use theirs.
reviews.title: A suprisingly nice business hotel

reviews.text: I was here for a conference and the conference rooms were OK and convenient. The best part about this hotel is the small store/coffee shop, 'Perks' on the first floor that is open most of the time. They sell just about anything you need, good coffee, breakfast and lunch fare, and fruit (the only place I found nearby that sold whole apples, bananas, and oranges). I also had lunch at the restaurant and that was OK.
reviews.title: Great location for convention centre

reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located by the River Walk, an OK mall (River Center mall), La Villita (a mini mexican art and craft shopping destination), and the Alamo.
reviews.title: Good location, adequate accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So overall a good experience for a business trip.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel with a great location and friendly staff

reviews.text: Visited the GH for a conference at the convention centre and it was the perfect location for this. Rooms were fine with a decent bed and the standard amenities. The restaurant was OK but there are better along the Riverwalk. It was a bit over-priced for what it was and I wouldn't come here with family but great for the convention centre.
reviews.title: A good conference hotel

reviews.text: There are two Hyatts in downtown San Antonio. One, on Lasoya Street, is terrific. The second, on East Market Street, is indeed downtown but it is a huge disappointment. Book carefully or you might be terribly disappointed. I have stayed at both. Stick to the Hyatt on Lasoya location. Request a room overlooking the river.
reviews.title: Right city, right chain, wrong Hyatt (pick the other one)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Following a nice stay at the Hyatt on Lasoya Street which unfortunately was fully booked i was assured by a Hyatt employee that I could move to the other location. He quoted a $209 rate for a room with a river view. When I arrived the rate was $299. Worse, no room overlooking the river. There are no rooms overlooking the river. It is on a busy street. And the fridge had a loud roaring motor. To the credit of the staff, when I complained, they reduced my rate and gave me access to a club for drinks. Nice touch.
reviews.title: Great Spring Break Trip

reviews.text: The Hyatt on East Market is convenient to the riverwalk but has lousy views of enormous parking lots. The lobby is strangely laid out. Just give it a miss. Go to La Mansion Omni on the river and request a river view if you cannot get into the Hyatt on Lasoya Street. Or stay at Hyatt East Market location and expect a great location at high price.
reviews.title: Nice on the inside

reviews.text: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt San Antonio during spring break. Check in was quick and painless. The hotel has a very modern look. The staff was professional and courteous.
reviews.title: Riverwalk Hotel

reviews.text: Our room was nice. The bed was very comfortable. We slept very well plus the room was very quiet. Very little noise heard from the hallway or adjacent rooms.
reviews.title: New and modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Grand Hyatt is a lovely highrise business oriented hotel in a convenient setting for shopping, Riverwalk, the Alamo and the convention center.
reviews.title: Business oriented hotel in great location

reviews.text: The rooms are a comfortable size, nicely appointed and have large windows allowing for great views. The location is great for sightseeing--it's an easy walk to RiverCenter shopping and HemisFair Park. Exiting on the lower level of the hotel puts you right on the Riverwalk within a short distance of the many restaurants on the water.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: I'd recommend the hotel for convenience and comfort but would choose elsewhere if you were into a hotel with more atmosphere.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: I was there on business last week. Everyone was super friendly - from the guy at the entrance, to the front desk people to the maids. The location is perfect - adjacent to the convention center and on the River Walk. The rooms are modern and clean.
reviews.title: Loved the location, hotel, staff and the room too....

reviews.text: I was in San Antonio for a conference and I chose this hotel because it was right next to the Convention Center. Luckily, it was also right next to the Riverwalk and the Rivercenter Mall and walking distance to the Alamo. The rooms were well maintained and clean. Housekeeping visited everday to make my bed and throw out my garbage. If you wanted something extra such as having your towels changed, you would have to special request it. The beds were comfortable and the view on the 20th floor was nice. The pool was descent and the fitness center had state of the art equipment. There was a cafe by the main lobby, a restaurant, lounge area, and a bar. I would recommend ordering a margarita at the bar!
reviews.title: Great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros:

reviews.text: Very Nice Looking Hotel and Lobby
reviews.title: Very nice room, beautiful view of Tower of America

reviews.text: Semi Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Self Parking costs $27 (No where did I See this and it is absurd)
reviews.title: When you're not nearly full why send a guest to a bad room?

reviews.text: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt while attending a conference at the Gonzalez Convention Center. This hotel is one of the best I have ever stayed at for business. The location could not have been any better - it was literally a few steps to the nearest convention center door and few more steps got me to the River Walk – and from there all the city life is accessible.
reviews.title: Top Notch

reviews.text: Pros: Extremely polite and helpful staff, very clean lobby and room, comfortable bed, nice linens, large bathroom and bathroom countertop with good lighting, speedy internet, nice television, flexible lighting in room, desk with plugs for working, and huge kudos goes out to the Grand Hyatt for having electrical outlets on the top of both nightstands! I could plug in all my electronics to have them accessible from bed without moving furniture or running an extension cord!!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location, friendly staff.

reviews.text: Cons: Pretty hard to come up with any. The bath products were a little fruity for my taste but probably high end. It is also not an inexpensive place to stay but at least they don’t leave you wishing for more for your money.
reviews.title: Relaxing

reviews.text: We used the Grand Hyatt San Antonio for our hotel to attend a meeting in the convention center. This hotel is connected to the convention center which made getting to and from the meeting easy and effortless. The check in process was efficient and the front desk person was extremely friendly and helpful. Parking was easy as well. The room is slightly smaller than average but not an issues. The view is scenic and soothing. The bed was slightly softer than I prefer but comfortable. The room was clean and the bathroom had nice supplies. Check out was a breeze as well as exiting from the garage and getting on the highway was close.
reviews.title: March 21, 2013

reviews.text: This is my 2nd stay here and it is very nice! The hotel is very well appointed and right in the middle of all the fun sights! The food is great especially the breakfast buffet. Definitely one of my favorite places to travel for business.
reviews.title: Worst customer service of anywhere in San Antonio

reviews.text: new and stylish but relatively loud business Hotel.
reviews.title: Stylish but loud

reviews.text: Good Restaurant and Bar.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel!

reviews.text: Direct acces to the famous River Walk and in walking distance to the mall.
reviews.title: not bad, but I expected a little more

reviews.text: Road and Railroad noise could be heared even on the 8th floor unfortunately until late in the night and latest from 5:30 a.m. The Grant is the newest but not the nicest Business Hotel in town.
reviews.title: Great Location, average rooms.

reviews.text: Very nice stay at this hotel. Rooms were nicely furnished and well supplied. Service from the staff was great. The restaurant on the river walk was very enjoyable with good food and service. The location is ideal--right on the river walk, next to the convention center and the mall.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, perfect for concention goers

reviews.text: Stayed five nights at the new Grand Hyatt. I have been to San Antonio at least a dozen times on business and stayed at almost every down town hotel. I watched this hotel being built over the last couple years and thought it was going to be spectacular. It’s really just ok. Of the two Hyatt’s in town the Grand Hyatt has the best location to the Henry Gonzalez convention center; it’s literally on the same property. I prefer the Hyatt Regency which sits on the River Walk in the center of town. (The Hyatt Regency is under renovations currently) The Grand Hyatt has a very large and modern lobby, desk staff are plenty and very friendly. There is a loud bar in the lobby and small gift shop. Rooms are modern and decorated in contemporary style furnishings....not very big but functional. The fitness center is excellent with at least a dozen treadmills and half dozen elliptical machines, yoga room, free weights and best yet open 24 hours. There is also an outdoor lap pool on the same level. Only ate one breakfast at the hotel in the Achiote River Cafe. Two Eggs, toast, orange jc and coffee was $22..!! There is a Denny's two blocks around the corner on Bowie Street...two minute walk....actually run very well...took about five minutes to get our food each morning and they were busy and very friendly. Lunch and dinner you can pick from anywhere on the Riverwalk. Mexican, Steaks, Seafood, Burgers....everything is there, no reservations needed. Cab fare from the airport to the hotel will run around $27 (two people) The Alamo is barely a ten minute walk and a shopping mall with a Macy's is across the street. Family friendly area.
reviews.title: Not too different from the Hyatt Regency in town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights in May and although the hotel was nice, it was nothing special and not nearly as nice as the typical Grand Hyatt. The rooms were clean and new, but small and nothing fancy. The bathroom was on the small side too. The restaurant was not good, I would not recommend it. The service at the hotel was good and everyone was nice. The pool is very small with few chairs around it. The location was fine, not too far from the restaurants of the Riverwalk. Overall, it was fine, but not worth the price.
reviews.title: Hotel was fine, not worth the money

reviews.text: Nice rooms. Staff polite. Advertised free wi fi in lobby which was not available. Good location, near river.
reviews.title: Nice rooms. Staff polite. Advertised free...

reviews.text: We stayed 6 nights for a conference.
reviews.title: If you want to enjoy your trip DON'T stay here!

reviews.text: I am SO disappointed with my stay at this hotel. My business colleague and I shared a room and she commented that this is the worse hotel experience she's had and she's stayed at Motel 6! I now understand why all other nearby hotels were booked during our conference visit! I wish we could have gotten a room at the Hampton Inn San Antonio instead of the Grand Hyatt San Antonio, but they were booked! However, perhaps it's a San Antonio thing since this was both our first visit here. Maybe because San Antonio is a smaller city the hotels believe they can skimp somewhat on quality. Actually I blame the American Academy of Sleep Medicine and the Sleep Research Society for selecting San Antonio as the site of this year's annual conference anyways!
reviews.title: Can't beat the Riverwalk Location

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for a conference April 25-28. The room was comfortable, though nothing spectacular. I was very impressed by the gym and room service. Victoria, who took my order, was very nice and demonstrated exemplary customer service. I told her later to compliment the chef on the excellent Vegan tofu wrap which I had had for the first time.
reviews.title: Average hotel with poor management
Rude
reviews.text: This hotel lost two stars from its rating due to the misleading Business Plan which promises a free buffet breakfast. When I went to the restaurant, I mentioned to the staff member that I had a business plan. The waiter asked for drinks, and I ordered them. He did not mention that they were not included. When I received the bill, I saw that drinks were charged separately. I asked to speak the restaurant manager, who rudely told me that Hyatt corporate policy is to pay for the buffet but not drinks. I have looked at Hyatt's fine print, and it does not mention that drinks will not be included in the $35 per day fees which pays for breakfast, internet, 1 liter water, and one pressed shirt per day. I have sent an email to the general manager, and I have not received a satisfactory response yet. I strongly recommend all guests to avoid picking the Business Plan which is a waste of money. The dishonesty of the hotel management is appalling. I will think twice before staying at a Hyatt hotel again.

I booked this hotel for a conference as part of a large group. When I arrived I was told the hotel had oversold and my reservation was moved to another Hyatt property across town. How do you oversell a hotel? I checked out of their other property and booked into the Marriott across the street to be closer to the conference. Don't trust a reservation with the sleazy management here.
reviews.title: Comfortable conference hotel in city center

reviews.text: I was mainly here for a conference inside the hotel, but came a little early to look around. The location is on an extension tp the Riverwalk, and indeed I was able to walk along the river all the way to the San Antonio Museum of Art, and take a river taxi back. It's about 10 minutes on foot along the river to the central Riverwalk where you find the crowds and restaurants.
reviews.title: Impressive, especially if one doesn't have to foot the bill

reviews.text: The room was of average size and quite serviceable for getting work done between conference sessions. A chair squeezed between the bed and window could have been more comfortable for reading, but the desk chair was fine. WiFi was included in my conference rate.
reviews.title: Convenient location for business traveler

description: With a dramatic design that exemplifies this unique city, the Grand Hyatt is an exciting blend of modernism and the Latin culture. Located on the Riverwalk, its warm hospitality and bold colors create a San Antonio Luxury hotel that is perfect for every guest, whether traveling for business or vacation. This urban retreat has a premier location, adjacent to the convention center and HemisFair Park. Our outstanding amenities and unprecedented services will make your experience extraordinary.
